Key Match Events: Persistent rain led to the match being reduced to nine overs per side.
Zimbabwe scored 79-5 with Wesley Madhevere hitting 35 off 18 balls.
Quinton de Kock scored 23 off the first over before South Africa's target was reduced to 64 off seven overs.
Richard Ngarava slipped and injured his thigh, prompting Zimbabwe to bowl only spin.
Regis Chakabva also slipped, leading to discussions about underarm bowling.
The match was abandoned due to heavy rain, with South Africa reaching their target but unable to complete the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Zimbabwe's coach Dave Houghton expressed dissatisfaction with the umpires' decision to continue the match despite dangerous weather.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first in the Menâ€™s T20 World Cup to be affected by rain and end as a no-result.
Heavy rain towards the end made it unsafe for play, leading to the match's abandonment.
